sense.def: Alternative Names xuan qi 痃氣 , string-illness qi.

Pathological Condition of acute pain located in the abdomen to the left and right of the umbilicus. Tai ping sheng hui fang 太平聖惠方 49: 痃者，在腹內近臍左右，各有一條筋脈急痛，大者如臂，次者 如指 , 因氣而起，如弦之狀，名曰痃氣也. “ String-illness is situated in the abdomen immediately to the left and right of the navel. On both sides a line of sinew vessels causes acute pain. Large ones are the size of an arm; smaller ones the size of a finger. One calls this 痃氣 , ‘string-illness qi’, because the formation of the qi assumes the shape of a string ( 弦 xian ) ”.
